section: 1.1 All defined terms In this Agreement not otherwise defined in this Section shall have the meanings assigned in the part of this Agreement in which they are defined.
explanation: This section contains a structural flaw. It says that all terms not defined in the section will have meanings assigned elsewhere, but does not specify where 'this Section' refers to, leading to potential ambiguity.

section: 2.7 If Bank of America is not in default of its obligations under this Agreement or the General Services Agreement of even date between Supplier and Bank of America, then at Bank of Americas request, Supplier shall deliver the then existing compiled and Source Code Software for the Cardlytics Software and any Improvements of thereto subject to the payment schedule to Supplier as outlined in Schedule A, Section B. Upon delivery, Bank of America will have all license right outlined in Section 2.7.1:
explanation: This section has an inconsistency. It says Bank of America will have all license rights outlined in Section 2.7.1 upon delivery, but Section 2.7.1 includes rights to patents and copyrights 'hereafter acquired by Supplier.' It's ambiguous how Supplier would transfer rights to IP not yet acquired.

section: 5.3 In addition to the Termination Events above, if the Services Schedule A of the General Services Agreement of even date between the parties to this Agreement expires, does not renew or terminates for any reason within the initial term and the Parties have not reached agreement on the delivery of the Software herein, then Cardlytics may terminate this Software License, Customization and Maintenance Agreement, including without limitation the Term License, shall terminate at the same time.
explanation: There is an omission here. It doesn't specify what happens if the parties HAVE reached agreement on the delivery of the Software before the General Services Agreement terminates, leading to uncertainty about the outcome in that scenario.
